meanings.definition: Causing an intense desire to eat or drink; appetizing
meanings.sent1: The smell of freshly baked cookies was mouthwateringly delicious.
meanings.sent2: The chef prepared a mouthwateringly tasty dish for the guests.
meanings.sent3: The sight of the chocolate cake was so mouthwateringly tempting that I couldn't resist.
meanings.sent4: The advertisement for the new restaurant described their food as mouthwateringly good.
meanings.sent5: The ripe strawberries looked mouthwateringly red and juicy.

meanings.definition: In a manner that makes one's mouth water; with great anticipation or desire
meanings.sent1: The aroma from the bakery wafted mouthwateringly through the air.
meanings.sent2: She described the dessert so mouthwateringly that everyone wanted a taste.
meanings.sent3: The thought of the upcoming vacation was mouthwateringly exciting.
meanings.sent4: The book's ending was so unexpected that it left me mouthwateringly curious for more.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation for the movie release grew mouthwateringly intense.
